Posts.Content: Hi guys I don't know if any if you remember me posting last week about the amount of pain I was in after my 1st round of docetaxel. It started with pain in my legs then travelled to my upper body. On Sunday I went to hospital & was admitted. With that chemo your sent home with an injection for 5 days that apparently builds up your white blood cells. I had a bad reaction to the injections making my white cell count drop to 0.4 which is way below what it should be. Because it dropped so low I caught an infection in hospital. The doctors have said they want me to continue with the injection next time and to be prepared because this can happen to me again. The only way I can describe the pain is childbirth with no baby at the end. I'm due to have the chemo again on 13th feb & I'm absolutely petrified
Posts.Title: Just spent 6 days in hospital

Posts.Content: Hi Sinai, my heart goes out to you hunnie. I've experienced the same stuff since being diagnosed with breast cancer in August so god knows how you must be coping. I always say positive mental attitude. Stay strong and use all the family & friends support you can. On days you have appointments see if a friend that gives you a good laugh & cheers you up can attend with you. Maybe go out for lunch with them after. Make it something to look forward to. Xxx
Posts.Title: Feeling fed up of treatment and hospitals.

Posts.Content: When i first had my scan and mammogram on August 6th this year my tumour was 5cm, all I was told at that point there was some abnormality in the lymph nodes. By the time I had my mastectomy on 3rd oct my tumour had grown to 120mm. I ended up having 16 nodes removed of which 5 were cancerous
Posts.Title: Further surgery for 'wider margins' and more lymph nodes to be re

Posts.Content: Go to your GP for a immediate referral to the breast clinic. People will say don't worry but we all know no matter what you will. I was trying on bikinis back in August when I see my lump. Yes SEE it. It was 120mm and took up most of my breast. It was non movable and felt like a big muscle and painless. Good luck. X
Posts.Title: nervous for my tests on Tuesday. trying too keep busy

Posts.Content: I start my chemo tomorrow, 6mths fect & 8 weeks radiotherapy. I've had my mastectomy which has caused me no problems except needing draining. As for the lymph node removal it's abit harder. All along I've been strong through this and surgery, but this morning I was sick. I've only had 2 toast for breakfast, my head is thumping and I'm in tears. The chemo is scaring me more than anything . This is all because I'm scared of the unknown
Posts.Title: Chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, my chemo lasted 3hrs. I got home about 4.30 this afternoon. I got the metal taste in my mouth almost immediately. I've had a very mild headache since about 6pm. Just taken my anti sickness pill as advised, going to take 2 paracetamol hoping my headache don't get much worse. On the whole I'm feeling rather good. Xxx
Posts.Title: Chemo tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Trudi, I feel just like you. I feel like I'm getting worse everyday. I'm in so much pain with one thing or another. My family seem to be doing less for me since I've stopped my chemo. Today I'm very tearful and oh HELLO their up cleaning. So do we need to be in tears infront of them before they realise WERE NOT WHERE WE WOULD LIKE TO BE and we can't do the things we would like to. Do we enjoy having a bald head and 1 tit. Did we ask for this dreadful disease. My family seem to think I've made a speedy recovery over night.
Posts.Title: help feel awful at 2 radiotherapy to go

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, my pathology report stated I had secondary cancer because it had travelled to the lymph nodes. My surgeon called my tumour a beast measuring in at 120mm or 12cm. Have any of you had a tumour as big as this.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Karen my surgeon and breast nurse have told me that from my main tumour 3 more tumours developed . They told me its called metastasis or if you prefer it's secondary cancer. The cancer then travelled to my lymph nodes. I had 16 removed of which 5 were cancerous.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Karen my surgeon and breast nurse have told me that from my main tumour 3 more tumours developed . They told me its called metastasis or if you prefer it's secondary cancer. The cancer then travelled to my lymph nodes. I had 16 removed of which 5 were cancerous.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: After being in agony all week with pains in my legs and swelling in them I eventually went to hospital Yesterday. Docs have said to me their treating me for a bloodclot as a precaution until I have a scan today to rule it out. If it's not a blood clot its Lymnphedema . How stupid of me. I've just realised not only am I swollen down one side I've not been able to wear my regular bras because I'm very swollen under the arm. So Im sure the blood clot will get ruled out. So now where do I go from here. What will the treatment be. And what will the complications be. One thing I have noticed over the past month is I could have a tiny spot and if for some reason the tiny scab comes off I loose quiet a bit of blood from it.Â
Posts.Title: Lymnphedema

Posts.Content: Hello everyone, my pathology report stated I had secondary cancer because it had travelled to the lymph nodes. My surgeon called my tumour a beast measuring in at 120mm or 12cm. Have any of you had a tumour as big as this.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: thank you Judith. Â under my arm is stinging like mad and tripled in size today. The pain goes down to my elbow. Since having chemo I find that when there's an infection somewhere in my body I get awful pains in my legs. Â I'm wondering if there is an infection lurking around under my arm. I stopped wearing wired bras after my mastectomy but over the past 3 days I've noticed my bras getting tighter, so now I'm wearing the soft type that I wear for bed. X
Posts.Title: Lymnphedema

Posts.Content: That's really interesting information. I now know mine started from 2 insect bites I have on that side. Â what I did notice after I got the bites was my veins in that leg started to pop out And became prominent . Thank you Hun. X
Posts.Title: Lymnphedema

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, my breast nurse said it was secondary cancer. I had 1 main tumour and 2 smaller in the same breast. Her words were " once it leaves the main tumour and spreads to the lymph nodes it becomes secondary cancer.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, my breast nurse said it was secondary cancer. I had 1 main tumour and 2 smaller in the same breast. Her words were " once it leaves the main tumour and spreads to the lymph nodes it becomes secondary cancer.
Posts.Title: 120mm tumour

Posts.Content: Hi kat, I've been following your story because it's quiet similar to how I found my lump. I just want you to know I had my examination, mamogram, scan & biopsy on the same day & was told to come back about 6hrs later for my results. I did have an advantage over most because my cousin was a childminder for the BCN and she really looked after me, but it goes to show you it can be done. I hope it's not the dreaded. There's no point in telling you not to worry because we've all been there & know what it's like. I will be thinking of you on tues & praying that your be ok. Good luck Hun & keep us updated. I hope it's goods news. Xxx
Posts.Title: will they be able to tell me something on the day of my tests?
